text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Cedric a cloud support
database engineer here at the AWS office
in Cape Town today I'll show you how to
upgrade your Aurora MyQ compatible
Global database to either a new minor or
major version let's get
started before you begin please note
that you can reverse a database upgrade
so as a best practice Ure to take a
snapshot of the database before
performing this action on your
production database this way you can
always restore a database from a
snapshot it's also a best practice to
test the obligation against the new
version before upgrading your production
database there are a few key differences
when upgrading the global database
cluster compared to upgrading a regular
aora cluster open the ads Management
console and navigate to Amazon
relational database service click
databases for minor Vision upgrades you
have to upgrade all secondary clusters
before you upgrade the primary
cluster please note to perform a minor
version upgrade to Aurora myql version
3.03 or higher or version 2.12 and
higher use the following process remove
all secondary regions from the global
cluster upgrade the engine version of
the primary region to 3.0 or higher or
212 and higher as applicable then add
the secondary region to the global
cluster once
again for major Vision upgrades the
entire Global cluster including all the
primary and secondary clusters is
upgraded at the same
time to upgrade the minor version of an
aurora myql Global database perform the
following steps start with the secondary
clust
select the cluster choose
modify for secondary clusters you will
be prompted to go to the Target region
change the database engine version and
choose continue to apply the
change on the next screen choose apply
immediately then modify
cluster you can also use the AWS CLI to
modify the engine version for each
cluster note that these actions have to
be applied in the region when the
cluster resides for Aurora MySQL minor
version upgrades are applied
automatically unless you turn off the
option during cluster creation for a
major version upgrade of an aurora
called Global database select the global
cluster not the individual clusters
choose modify change the DB engine
version and then choose continue to
apply the change make sure you read
through the popup message explaining
downtime notes then click modify Global
database you can also use the aw CLI to
modify the major version of the Aurora
my squ Global
database so now you know how to upgrade
an Amazon Aurora my squ Global database
to a new minor or major
version thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
